text: Milena Djukić (born 1 July 1960 in Gracanica, SFR Yugoslavia), played until 1991 in Yugoslavia basketball. Djukić started her career at Jedinstvo Aida in Tuzla. In the 1980s, the club won as Jedinstvo Aida three championships in the Yugoslav basketball league for women. During her career she won three national championships and a national cup. Djukić married Lučić. She lives in Germany today. She is a specialist in occupational medicine and sports medicine. In May 2015, she received her doctorate from Eberhard Karls University Tübingen (Germany). ==Honours== *Championship of Yugoslavia Champions 1st place 1987, 1988 *Yugoslav Cup Champions 1st place 1988 *European cups FIBA Women's European Champions Cup Semi-finalist 3rd place 1988 ==References== *https://publikationen.%5B%5Buni- tuebingen%5D%5D.de/xmlui/bitstream/handle/10900/63821/Zum%20Stellenwert%20k%C3%B6rperlicher%20Aktivit%C3%A4t%20in%20der%20Pr%C3%A4vention%20von%20muskuloskelettalen%20und%20psychischen%20Gesundheitsst%C3%B6rungen%20im%20beruflichen%20Umfeld%20-%20Lucic%2C%20Milena%20geb.%20Djukic-%20Universit%C3%A4t%20T%C3%BCbingen%20-%202015-05-04.pdf?sequence=1&isAllowed;=y Category:Yugoslavian basketball players Category:1960 births Category:Living people Category:German doctors
title: Milena Djukic
